project.teaser: Currently, the use of bio-composites is limited to less critical applications that do not have significant requirements in terms of mechanical performance. However, the use of synthetic composites made from carbon or glass fibre has several difficulties in terms recycling and...
project.objective: Currently, the use of bio-composites is limited to less critical applications that do not have significant requirements in terms of mechanical performance. However, the use of synthetic composites made from carbon or glass fibre has several difficulties in terms recycling and in terms of dependence on third countries. About 98% of these synthetic composites still end up in landfills and about 80% of the raw materials are currently manufactured outside of Europe. To improve this situation, the project addresses the challenges of using bio-composites for structural parts and aims to increase the range of applications in which bio-composites can be used. This will be achieved by developing an accurate draping process to control fibre orientation, by creating material models that capture the natural variability of the material and by integrating nano-structured, bio-based sensors for load monitoring. Through the increased accuracy and additional control loops in the manufacturing process the consortium expects to achieve predictable properties and constant quality. Within the project use cases from wind energy and boat-building will be investigated, aiming at the manufacturing of a full size rotor blade and a ship hull to demonstrate the technical feasibility and achieving TRL7 for the manufacturing technologies. In addition to the end users, the consortium consists of partners from automation, machine building, measurement technology, material manufacturing and simulation software to cover all aspects of the developments. Based on the predicted growth of the bio-composites market, which is expected to increase by a factor of 2.5 by 2030, the consortium expects a market potential of about 100M€ by 2030.
project.title: Manufacturing process for bio-based fibre-reinforced composite parts for structural applications

article.title: Turning the tide: sustainable alternatives to synthetic composites

result.title: Project web page and visual identity
result.description: This deliverable is the project web page and a “visual identity” package. The report will describe the structure, the content and the intended use of the web page, as well as the logo, colours, fonts, styles and templates to be used by all project partners throughout the project.

result.title: Bonding process and experimental results
result.description: This prototype deliverable will be the initial design of the bio-adhesives, set up of an industrial-like bonding process equipment, and first experimental results of the bonding process using bio-adhesives. Quality control for bonding process and/or bonded parts will be described.

result.title: Curing process and experimental results
result.description: This prototype deliverable will be the initial design of the bio-resin, it will describe adaptations made to curing equipment for the integration of process monitoring, and first experimental results of the curing using bio-resins.

result.title: Individual process demonstration and evaluation report
result.description: This report will describe the results of demonstrations done at the level of single processes. It will assess the results in relation to the specifications defined in WP2 and provide a guideline for the following development steps.

result.title: Data Management plan
result.description: The deliverable will include a plan describing the data collected throughout the project, their status and how non-confidential research data will be made available to other researchers in a repository.

result.title: Draping process and experimental results
result.description: This prototype deliverable will be the demonstrator for the automatic draping process, including the necessary hardware components, their integration and first experimental results of the draping of natural fibres.

result.title: LCA data inventory
result.description: This deliverable consists of the data collected for performing the environmental and economic life cycle assessment for the single use cases.

result.title: Initial version of bio-based load sensors
result.description: The deliverable will be the initial implementation of a load sensor using bio-materials on a (not necessarily bio-based) sample substrate. The deliverable will describe first experimental data and assess signal quality.

result.title: European raw material supplier mapping
result.description: This mapping will include several aspects to qualify the suppliers of bio-based raw materials including localization, sourcing, production capacity, R&D capability, financial health.

result.title: Set of coupons and their characterization
result.description: This deliverable will be a set of coupons made of bio-composites and material samples of natural fabrics, including their characterization and results of mechanical testing. It will also describe the transfer of the results to material models for simulation.

category.title: sensors

category.title: waste treatment processes

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
